name: Boston United FC History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: What year were Boston United formed?
questions.explanation:
1933.

	Boston entered the Midland League in 1933, which was a league mainly for reserve teams. They eventually finished 14th out of 17 teams with 25 points from 32 games.

questions.text: What year were Boston promoted into the Football League, Division Three?
questions.explanation:
2002.

	Boston won the Conference title with on goal difference over second placed Dagenham & Redbridge, with both teams reaching 84 points.

Jimmy Cringan.

	Former Birmingham midfielder Cringham was player/manager for the club for one season in 1934-35.

questions.text: Which of these players scored the most goals in a season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Colin Smith.

	Smith scored an incredible 58 goals in the 1961-62 Central Alliance League.

questions.text: In October 2002, Boston signed a player with the same name as a former professional snooker player. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Alex Higgins.

	Higgins started his career at his hometown club of Sheffield Wednesday, before moving onto Queens Park Rangers, Chester City, Stalybridge Celtic and finally Boston United. Steve Davis was also a professional footballer in 2002 with Burnley.

questions.text: When Boston first entered the Football League, where did they play their home matches?
questions.explanation:
York Street.

	Boston's first game in the Football League was played here on 10th August, 2002 against Bournemouth, in a game that finished a 2-2 draw.

questions.text: Who was Boston's first Football League victory against?
questions.explanation:
Lincoln City.

	The game finished 2-0 to Boston at York Street, with goals from Simon Weatherstone and Daryl Clare.

questions.text: Which former Nottingham Forest, Bolton Wanderers and Charlton Athetic veteran was signed by the club in July 2002?
questions.explanation:
Neil Redfearn.

	Redfearn started his career at Nottingham Forest, before moving on to Bolton, Lincoln, Doncaster, Crystal Palace, Watford, Oldham, Barnsley, Charlton, Bradford, Wigan, Halifax Town, and then Boston.

questions.text: Which experienced manager was once player/manager for the club?
questions.explanation:
Howard Wilkinson.

	Wilkinson's played for the club in 1972, but became player/manager in 1975.

questions.text: Why did Steve Evans resign as manager of the club in 2002?
questions.correct: Charges of financial irregularities were brought against him by the FA
options: He left to become manager of Northampton Town
He didn't want to manage a Football League club
His heart wasn't in the job and retired from the game
questions.explanation:
Charges of financial irregularities were brought against him by the FA.

	Evans was suspended by the club after the charges were brought against him, and resigned in September 2002. The club were later docked four points for season 2002-03. Credits go to the Boston United webmaster for correcting a few of these.
